Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: An object that gets invoked at the beginning of an application but before the application main loop starts. It's used largely for application setup--- for example, reading RC files.
Registers a function to be called when the mainloop is started.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool Check (ref string[] argv);

Docs.summary: Initializes Gtk# for operation, probes window system.
Docs.param: The command line arguments passed in. Changed if any arguments were handled.
Docs.returns: True if the toolkit initialized correctly, false otherwise.
Docs.remarks: Aside from the arguments, this function behaves in the same way as . By returning whether or not the toolkit initialized correctly, it allows the application to fall back to a non-GUI interface, should the developer be so inclined to write one.
